Def.Name: Rock elm
Def.Description: Medium - large tree growing 40' - 80' tall; cylindrical crown with drooping branches. Trunk can grown to 48" in diameter.
Def.Leaves: Alternate, simple, 2 1/2" - 4" long, 3/4" - 2" wide, doubly toothed margins, base uneven, dark green and smooth above, paler and somewhat downy beneath. Turning yellow in autumn.
Def.Twigs: Red-brown, zigzag, developing irregular corky ridges; buds are brown with sharp pointed tips.
Def.SeedConeOrFruit: Fruit: Samara, 3/8" - 3/4" diameter, oval to obvate in shape. Has a shallowly notched tip and mutures in spring.
Def.Bark: Red-gray and rough; becoming darker gray, deeply furrowed with interlacing ridges.
Def.Range: Hardy to zone 3a. Common to the Upper Mississippi valley.
Def.Remarks: Used in the construction of battleships.
